name: Mount Fuji
about: Mount Fuji, at 3,776 meters, is Japan's highest peak and an active stratovolcano. Its nearly symmetrical cone makes it a cultural icon and UNESCO World Heritage Site. Itâ€™s a sacred site and popular for hiking.

name: Colosseum Amphitheatre
about: The Colosseum is a massive stone amphitheater built in 70-80 AD. It hosted gladiatorial contests and public spectacles. A UNESCO World Heritage Site, it remains a symbol of Roman engineering and culture.

name: London Bridge
about: London Bridge spans the River Thames. The current concrete and steel bridge opened in 1973, replacing older versions. Historically significant, it connects the City of London with Southwark.

name: Eiffel Tower
about: The Eiffel Tower, a 330-meter iron lattice structure, was built in 1889 for the World's Fair. A global symbol of France and one of the most visited monuments, it offers breathtaking views of Paris.
